title: Sow Discord in Brightdune
prologue1: Finding the cloaked Freetrader within Giant's Gate confirmed our worst fears. The Empire has conquered the Gray Plains, and now turns their attention towards us. The Autarch grows in sorcerous power, and looks longingly at Brightdune.
prologue2: The Empire will exploit old hatreds between the Amber Hand and the Five-Fold.
prologue3: The Empire will stoke fears for the coming harvests, sabotaging our grain and our rice, and blaming the loss on our selfishness.
prologue4: The Empire will look to our hinterlands, enticing the settlers and traders with whispers made of marble and bronze.
prologue5: And worst of all, the Imperial Autarch draws sorcerous power from our lands in pursuit of a terrible apotheosis.

title: Mobilize War Machines
prologue1: Keel wrapped his gray chlamys tightly around his body, in a feeble attempt to block out the cold rain. He crouched down on the cold stone of the wall overlooking the military ward.
prologue2: Far below Keel, scattered everywhere, were components of steel, wood, and other materials not recognizable. Imperial artificers, clad in their distinctive green and gold tunics, went about the business of assembling these parts into large constructions on a grand scale. Some of these machines seemed to burn from within, a strange fire the didn't consume the device.
prologue3: Keel took note, trying to understand how they may work, how they may be used. But fear also struck in his heart. How would Brightdune defend themselves?

title: Isolate Brightdune's Allies
prologue1: 'No,' said Hogel, head bowed in shame.
prologue2: 'Good,' The Subtect replied. 'And that goes for your new friends as well. You'd do well remember that Brightdune is a haven for witchcraft and dark sorcery, best expunged from our holy shores. Meddling in these affairs will only curse you and all those you love.'
prologue3: Hogel glanced over at his retinue, then stood up, bowed, and left the meeting tent. It was unnerving to have Imperial visitors, much less The Subtect, official scribe and voice for The Autarch. And if Hogel had received this sort of warning, it was safe to assume others had as well.

title: Unravel the Weave of Fates
prologue1: 'I know,' Oniri said, looking toward the dense trees in the moonlight. 'I can see it.'
prologue2: 'You can?' Yasmina said softly. 'I can feel the Autarch pulling at the wild threads in these forests, but I can't find the source. I can just sense anguish from the flora and fauna. Their fires are being extinguished.'
prologue3: Yasmina closed her eyes as the swift-moving mountain stream sprayed frigid water against her face.
prologue4: 'When the Weavers of the Downward Tulip recorded the fates into their carpet, they were burned for their troubles,' Yasmina said. 'People need the illusion. Except, well, except for the Autarch. The Autarch has found the pattern in the ashes, a pattern from when the first tribes left the Dawncaves.'
prologue5: Oniri made a sound like swirling dust.

title: Root Out the Traitors Within
prologue1: Metrodora set the plate of red wine pork down in front of the Freetrader guard. 'Blessed be The Autarch! May the sweat of her brow grace our tongues.'
prologue2: The guard smiled while his gray-cloaked companion eyed Metrodora carefully.
prologue3: 'Indeed, the Autarch alone can cleanse us,' the gray-cloak said. 'Please continue to inform us of any gatherings the locals here undertake. It is so easy for enemy agents to corrupt the great peace and bounty the Autarch provides.'
prologue4: Metrodora glanced towards a busy section of the barley trough, then fixed her gaze back on the gray-cloak, hoping nothing was given away.
prologue5: 'My life is in servitude and benevolent awe to the Autarch,' Metrodora said.

title: Achieve Apotheosis
prologue1: The Autarch stood, resolute, in the cold light of The Hall of Faces. She held the golden Icon of the First Autarch, the shining face entwined with the Sigil of Channeling. White robed figures surrounded her in a semicircle, a shimmering golden thread linking their hands together.
prologue2: 'It is time to conclude this tale,' the Autarch said. 'It is time to unify the Empire. Six winters past, we began a great project, only now reaching its natural conclusion.'
prologue3: The Autarch closed her eyes, feeling the faraway lands rich with life and vitality, pulling the threads of energy into the Hall. 'I can feel our home,' the Autarch continued. 'Every blade of grass. Every stone. Every brook. It is part of me, and I am part of it. We will finally be made whole.'
